title: Area of the region bounded by two polar curves

content.description: Let S be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of the polar curve r = cos <math> <mi>θ</mi> </math> and bounded below by the graph of the polar curve r = 2<math> <mi>θ</mi> </math>, as shown in the figure above. The two curves intersect when <math> <mi>θ</mi> </math> = 0.450.
content.question: What is the area of S ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.9: (BC ONLY) Finding the Area of the Region Bounded by Two Polar Curves

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
